conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to understand the flow path of liquid through the baffles, identify key connections, and determine where the liquid will flow.
The image shows containers A, B, C, and D connected by pipes and baffles. Containers E, F, and G are connected to the flow path.
Liquid can flow out of containers A, B, C, and D.
Liquid from A flows through a pipe connected to E.
Liquid from B passes through a baffle connected to F.
Liquid from C flows through a pipe leading to G.
Liquid from D flows through a baffle leading to E.
E is connected to A and D; F is connected to B; G is connected to C.
Liquid from A and D ends up in E, liquid from B ends up in F, and liquid from C ends up in G.
